metadata.title: CVE-2024-9680 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - high
metadata.description:
An attacker was able to achieve code execution in the content process byexploiting a use-after-free in Animation timelines. We have had reports ofthis vulnerability being exploited in the wild. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 131.0.2, Firefox ESR < 128.3.1, Firefox ESR < 115.16.1,Thunderbird < 131.0.1, Thunderbird < 128.3.1, and Thunderbird < 115.16.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-9680` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 131.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 131.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 131.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:115.16.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.16.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.16.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.16.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.16.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.16.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '131.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.16.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
